Both RIGHT and DOWN improve our Manhattan distance, but heading RIGHT increases our x coordinate, which we need to do substantially (from 2 up to 6) to reach (6,5). Staying at x=2 a little longer by moving DOWN might delay our progress in that direction.

Looking ahead, moving RIGHT to (3,7) keeps us in a central location while steadily closing the gap horizontally. The enemy snake at (8,6) is far enough away that our chosen path remains safe.
